node.title: 'We're so late now': Nursing boss, National critical of job campaign timing
node.description: An overseas recruitment campaign targeting specialist nurses will go live this week, but critics say it's far too late two years into the pandemic.

node.title: D.C. to give early educators $10,000 checks to supplement pay
node.description: Washington, D.C., to roll out largest-in-the-nation direct cash grant program for early-childhood educators.

node.title: Senator Ben Ray Luján expected to be back at work in 4 to 6 weeks after stroke
node.description: The New Mexico senator suffered a stroke last week.

node.title: Sekope Kepu to captain Moana Pasifika
node.description: Former Wallaby prop Sekope Kepu will captain Moana Pasifika for their debut season in Super Rugby Pacific.

node.title: Slain NYPD officer honored with hero's funeral
node.description: Thousands of officers filled the streets to mourn Wilbert Mora, who was shot along with his partner, Jason Rivera, while responding to a domestic violence call.

node.title: West Coast: Civil defence remains on high alert as downpours continue
node.description: Civil defence officials remain on alert in the West Coast, with heavy rain still pelting down and further significant falls forecast.

node.title: As Boris Johnson Seeks a Reset, More Tory Lawmakers Defect
node.description: Britain’s prime minister tried to steer attention away from a damning report on Downing Street parties, but his support continued to erode.

node.title: Millions of low-income Americans to get tax refund boost
node.description: Childless workers this year can claim an Earned Income Tax Credit worth up to $1,500 — triple the usual amount.

node.title: 4 arrested in connection with overdose death of actor Michael K. Williams
node.description: Williams died​ last year at the age of 54.

node.title: Expert panel reaffirms directed energy could be behind "Havana Syndrome"
node.description: A declassified summary of an expert panel's findings found that the mysterious neurological condition may be "plausibly" explained by pulsed, electromagnetic energy.

node.title: Cable fatally electrocutes 26 people in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
node.description: The Kinshasa tragedy occurred as news broke of a massacre in the troubled east of the country.

node.title: COVID creates hurdles for Supreme Court nominee meetings with senators
node.description: There's no nominee yet, but some senators already disagree about whether virtual meetings would be an option.

node.title: Lake with clearest water in world under threat
node.description: Nelson's Rotomairewhenua/Blue Lake, which has the clearest water in the world, is facing a threat from an invasive diatom that blooms into a slimy, clinging algae-like substance.

node.title: National Archives says it will turn over Mike Pence's records to January 6 panel
node.description: President Biden declined to uphold former President Donald Trump's claims asserting executive privilege over a new batch of documents.

node.title: NYC delivery workers demand more workplace rights
node.description: A new labor coalition is pushing for higher pay, health care and the right to unionize for the gig workforce.

node.title: First Covid vaccine for children under 5 considered in US
node.description: US regulators are considering the first Covid-19 vaccine for children under the age of 5, the only age group not yet eligible for the shots.

node.title: Perlina Lau's streaming picks: Back to the Gilded Age
node.description: Marvelous Mrs Maisel is back, a new Victorian costume drama debuts and the story of Pamela Anderson and Tommy Lee is told. RNZ's Perlina Lau takes a look at the best TV on the streamers in February.

node.title: ‘The Lost City’ and a Richard Linklater Film Will Play SXSW
node.description: The film festival will return to primarily in-person screenings in Austin, Texas, with some online options.

node.title: State of emergency declared as heavy rain moves up West Coast
node.description: A state of emergency has been declared in the Buller District, with heavy rain set to continue in the region for the next few days.

node.title: US trying to draw Russia into war, says Putin
node.description: Russia's President Vladimir Putin has accused the United States of trying to draw his country into a war in Ukraine.

node.title: Tiwai Point closure: Transition plan for Southland revealed
node.description: Clean energy industries are at the core of a new government plan for how Southland will cope with Tiwai Point aluminium smelter shutting down.

node.title: National Party to allow conscience vote on conversion therapy ban bill
node.description: The National Party will allow MPs to vote with their conscience on a bill banning conversion therapy, after MPs collectively voted against the first reading under Judith Collins.

node.title: New details emerge in shooting outside Minnesota school
node.description: One student was killed in the shooting and another remains hospitalized in critical condition.

node.title: Live Updates: Massive winter storm moving east across U.S.
node.description: The storm caused blizzard conditions in North Dakota and has dumped several inches of snow in Chicago.

node.title: Newborn missing in Memphis after mother found shot to death
node.description: Police are encouraging residents with information to reach out.

node.title: NY blows past $1B in online sports bets in just 3 weeks
node.description: "There's not a question: New York is already the largest sports betting state in the country," a gambling industry expert said.

node.title: How a Plea Deal in the Arbery Hate Crime Case Unraveled
node.description: Prosecutors thought they had come up with an iron-clad deal to put Ahmaud Arbery’s killers away. But for his family, it wasn’t enough.

node.title: Invercargill council holds project governance group in public
node.description: The Invercargill City Council held its first project governance group meeting in public instead of behind closed doors on Wednesday.

node.title: People mistakenly assume products are safe, top regulator says
node.description: U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission chief urges shoppers to do their homework before making a purchase.

node.title: A Music Museum Opens in the Heart of Hungary’s Culture Wars
node.description: At City Park in Budapest, a building project has come to exemplify the politics of Viktor Orban, the country’s far-right prime minister.
